page.title: 08Badgers
page.content: Brockenhurst is famous for badgers and the symbol of both the village and the local primary school is a badger. Badgers have faces which are white with a broad black stripe on each side. the rest of their fur looks grey but is really made up of black and white banded hairs. The underneath part of their body is black.As they usually go out only at night they are very difficult to see except for their faces.They live in underground tunnels called setts,which they dig out of the ground.They always use a tree near the entrance to clean their claws and you can sometimes find these scratched trees.They build a great many passages in their setts and the rooms have air holes to ventilate them.Badgers are very clean and change their bedding 2 or 3 times a year.Badgers are short sighted but have acute sense of smell.
